name: ITP-002 - Watermain Construction Stage 2
template name: ITP-002 - Watermain Construction Stage 2 - Rev A

name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Photos of worksite including vehicle access points.
Acceptance Criteria - Coverage of whole site
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Verify Construction Drawings that are in the site folder are the latest revision.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Corridor access Permit.
○ Block by block Temporary Traffic Management Plans.
Acceptance Criteria - Permit & Traffic Plan approved
Verifying Document - Work Access Permit & TMP
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - H&S Plan
Acceptance Criteria - Plans & Safety Measures in place
Verifying Document - H&S Plan, Method Statement
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Notice of works to properties in the construction zone in each block
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Shutdown/Isolation process verified in each block closure
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Correctly mark out the position of the new pipelines for construction.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Permit to excavate for the location has been endorsed by an authorised person.
Acceptance Criteria - Permit to excavate endorsed
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Visual check of materials delivered:
○ Free of defects – surface abrasion, ovality, not kinked or crushed
Acceptance Criteria - Correct material & no defects
Reference: Contract Specs/Standards - D2.4,D3.3, D4.3, D5.3, D8.3
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Stored as per manufacturers specifications including maximum height limits and safely chocked in place.
○ No scoring of pipe more than 10% of thickness.
○ No damage to epoxy coating on Ductile fittings.
Acceptance Criteria - Stored as per manufacturer
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Trench width to be sufficient to safely lay the pipe (including shoring if required) and compact the side support of the new pipe. Bedding details below;
○ Sufficient room to enable the pipe, joint, bed, haunch or surround shown in the drawings to be accommodated.
○ Trench depth to enable pipe to be laid with the designed cover as shown on construction plans.
○ If trench bottom to be suitable to compact pipe bedding as support pipe.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Block by block ensure existing live services are not unnecessarily damaged by works.
○ Repair any services that are temporarily removed during construction.
Acceptance Criteria - Existing services not damaged
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Interior of each pipe visually inspected to ensure free of debris.
○ Re-cap end of pipe after installation.
○ Check pipe installed at correct depth.
○ Ensure all collars are free from contamination in McDougall St berm
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes free of debris & correctly installed
Reference: Contract Specs/Standards - D2.5, D2.7, D8.4.2
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Check dimensions of formwork match details in the Construction Drawings.
○ Check pipe fitting joints are clear of concrete pour.
○ Thrust blocks to be poured against good solid natural ground.
Acceptance Criteria - Thrust blocks against solid ground
Verifying Document - Daily Site Diary & Photos
Reference: Contract Specs/Standards - D5.1, D5.3.2, D5.7
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Confirm depth requirements have been met;
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Confirm trenches in paved areas are compacted to standard block by block.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Hydrostatic pressure test on new pipeline and fittings block by block.
Verifying Document - Pressure Test Record Sheet
Reference: Contract Specs/Standards - D2.9.1, AS/NSZ 2566.2:2002 Section 6
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Flushing and sterilizing full length of new pipeline and fittings block by block.
Reference: Contract Specs/Standards - D2.9.1, AS/NSZ 2566.2:2002 Section 6
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Capture data for all new construction work.
Acceptance Criteria - Redline mark-up plan submitted
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Work is inspected by the authorised person and complies with the nominated specification/standards
Acceptance Criteria - Work inspected & complies with standards
